verses.verse: So these <WH428> three <WH7969> men <WH582> ceased <WH7673> to answer <WH6030> Job, <WH347> because <WH3588> he was righteous <WH6662> in his own eyes. <WH5869>

Then was kindled <WH2734> the wrath <WH639> of Elihu <WH453> the son <WH1121> of Barachel <WH1292> the Buzite, <WH940> of the kindred <WH4940> of Ram: <WH7410> against Job <WH347> was his wrath <WH639> kindled, <WH2734> because <WH5921> he justified <WH6663> himself <WH5315> rather than <WH4480> God. <WH430>

Also against his three <WH7969> friends <WH7453> was his wrath <WH639> kindled, <WH2734> because <WH5921> <WH834> they had found <WH4672> no <WH3808> answer, <WH4617> and yet had condemned <WH7561> Job. <WH347>
Now Elihu <WH453> had waited <WH2442> till Job <WH347> had spoken, <WH1697> because <WH3588> they were elder <WH2205> <WH3117> than he.
When Elihu <WH453> saw <WH7200> that there was no <WH369> answer <WH4617> in the mouth <WH6310> of these three <WH7969> men, <WH582> then his wrath <WH639> was kindled. <WH2734>

And Elihu <WH453> the son <WH1121> of Barachel <WH1292> the Buzite <WH940> answered <WH6030> and said, <WH559> I am young, <WH6810> <WH3117> and you are very <WH3453> old; <WH3453> why <WH5921> <WH3651> I was afraid, <WH2119> and dared <WH3372> not show <WH2331> you my opinion. <WH1843>
I said, <WH559> Days <WH3117> should speak, <WH1696> and multitude <WH7230> of years <WH8141> should teach <WH3045> wisdom. <WH2451>
But there is a spirit <WH7307> in man: <WH582> and the inspiration <WH5397> of the Almighty <WH7706> gives them understanding. <WH995>
Great <WH7227> men are not always wise: <WH2449> neither do the aged <WH2205> understand <WH995> judgment. <WH4941>
Therefore <WH3651> I said, <WH559> Listen <WH8085> to me; I also <WH637> will show <WH2331> my opinion. <WH1843>
Behold, <WH2005> I waited <WH3176> for your words; <WH1697> I gave ear <WH238> to your reasons, <WH8394> whilst <WH5704> you searched <WH2713> out what to say. <WH4405>
Yes, I attended <WH995> to you, and, behold, <WH2009> there was none <WH369> of you that convinced <WH3198> Job, <WH347> or that answered <WH6030> his words: <WH561>
Lest <WH6435> you should say, <WH559> We have found <WH4672> out wisdom: <WH2451> God <WH410> thrusts <WH5086> him down, not man. <WH376>
Now he has not directed <WH6186> his words <WH4405> against <WH413> me: neither <WH3808> will I answer <WH7725> him with your speeches. <WH561>
They were amazed, <WH2865> they answered <WH6030> no <WH3808> more: <WH5750> they left <WH6275> off speaking. <WH4405>
When I had waited, <WH3176> (for they spoke <WH1696> not, but stood <WH5975> still, <WH5975> and answered <WH6030> no <WH3808> more; <WH5750>)
I said, I will answer <WH6030> also <WH637> my part, <WH2506> I also <WH637> will show <WH2331> my opinion. <WH1843>
For I am full <WH4390> of matter, <WH4405> the spirit <WH7307> within <WH990> me constrains <WH6693> me.
Behold, <WH2009> my belly <WH990> is as wine <WH3196> which has no <WH3808> vent; <WH6605> it is ready to burst <WH1234> like new <WH2319> bottles. <WH178>
I will speak, <WH1696> that I may be refreshed: <WH7304> I will open <WH6605> my lips <WH8193> and answer. <WH6030>
Let me not, I pray <WH4994> you, accept <WH5375> any man's <WH376> person, <WH6440> neither <WH3808> let me give flattering <WH3655> titles to man. <WH120>
For I know <WH3045> not to give flattering <WH3655> titles; in so doing my maker <WH6213> would soon <WH4592> take <WH5375> me away.
